0: Prepare and process import and export documentation according to customs regulations, laws, or procedures.
Clear goods through customs and to their destinations for clients.
Pay, or arrange for payment of, taxes and duties on shipments.
Calculate duty and tariff payments owed on shipments.
Request or compile necessary import documentation, such as customs invoices, certificates of origin, and cargo-control documents.
Classify goods according to tariff coding system.
Stay abreast of changes in import or export laws or regulations by reading current literature, attending meetings or conferences, or conferring with colleagues.
Sign documents on behalf of clients, using powers of attorney.
Advise customers on import and export restrictions, tariff systems, insurance requirements, quotas, or other customs-related matters.
Post bonds for the products being imported or assist clients in obtaining bonds.
Quote duty and tax rates on goods to be imported, based on federal tariffs and excise taxes.
Arrange for transportation, warehousing, or product distribution of imported or exported products.
Monitor or trace the location of goods.
Confer with officials in various agencies to facilitate clearance of goods through customs and quarantine.
Inform importers and exporters of steps to reduce duties and taxes.
Obtain line releases for frequent shippers of low-risk commodities, high-volume entries, or multiple-container loads.
Provide advice on transportation options, types of carriers, or shipping routes.
Contract with freight forwarders for destination services.
Apply for tariff concessions or for duty drawbacks and other refunds.
Insure cargo against loss, damage, or pilferage.
Prepare papers for shippers to appeal duty charges.
1: Analyze training needs to develop new training programs or modify and improve existing programs.
Evaluate instructor performance and the effectiveness of training programs, providing recommendations for improvement.

Plan, develop, and provide training and staff development programs, using knowledge of the effectiveness of methods such as classroom training, demonstrations, on-the-job training, meetings, conferences, and workshops.
Confer with management and conduct surveys to identify training needs based on projected production processes, changes, and other factors.
Conduct orientation sessions and arrange on-the-job training for new hires.
Train instructors and supervisors in techniques and skills for training and dealing with employees.
Develop and organize training manuals, multimedia visual aids, and other educational materials.
Prepare training budget for department or organization.
Develop testing and evaluation procedures.
Conduct or arrange for ongoing technical training and personal development classes for staff members.
Review and evaluate training and apprenticeship programs for compliance with government standards.
2: Monitor and record food temperatures to ensure food safety.
Cook foodstuffs according to menus, special dietary or nutritional restrictions, or numbers of portions to be served.
Rotate and store food supplies.
Wash pots, pans, dishes, utensils, or other cooking equipment.
Apportion and serve food to facility residents, employees, or patrons.
Clean and inspect galley equipment, kitchen appliances, and work areas to ensure cleanliness and functional operation.
Clean, cut, and cook meat, fish, or poultry.
Direct activities of one or more workers who assist in preparing and serving meals.
Train new employees.
Take inventory of supplies and equipment.
Requisition food supplies, kitchen equipment, and appliances, based on estimates of future needs.
Bake breads, rolls, or other pastries.

0: Verify importer's information and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements
Clear goods for export by preparing required documentation and submitting it to the relevant authorities
Inspect shipments for any damages or discrepancies prior to customs clearance
Communicate with importers and exporters to resolve issues related to shipping and delivery
Research and comply with regulations and laws related to international trade
Manage warehouse space and inventory levels by receiving, storing, and dispatching goods
Monitor and report on compliance with customs regulations and tariffs
Negotiate rates and agreements with carriers and freight forwarders on behalf of clients
Maintain accurate records of shipments, invoices, and other financial transactions related to international trade
Conduct inspections at warehouses and distribution centers to ensure compliance with customs regulations
Prepare and submit applications for licenses and permits required for international trade
Coordinate transportation arrangements between countries and within regions
Investigate disputes or irregularities related to shipments or documentation
Maintain relationships with suppliers, importers, and exporters through regular communication
Stay up-to-date on changes in customs regulations, laws, and procedures through ongoing training and education
Manage and resolve issues related to customs clearance, such as delays or lost shipments
Create and implement customized shipping solutions for clients' unique needs
Provide expert advice and guidance to clients on customs-related matters
Collaborate with government agencies, such as U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP), on customs regulations
Prepare and submit Harmonized System (HS) codes for exports
Manage and analyze data related to imports and exports, including revenue and volume trends
1: Developing training programs to enhance employee skills and knowledge, in line with business goals and objectives
Designing and implementing performance management systems to evaluate employee competence
Coordinating logistics for workshops, conferences, and other corporate events
Analyzing training data to identify trends and make informed decisions about future training initiatives
Creating training materials, such as manuals, guides, and online resources, to support employee development
Collaborating with subject matter experts to create high-quality training content
Conducting needs assessments to determine the skills gaps in employees
Identifying and implementing new technologies or tools to enhance training programs
Developing and maintaining relationships with vendors and suppliers to support training initiatives
Creating a schedule for training sessions, workshops, and other corporate events
Evaluating the effectiveness of training programs and making recommendations for improvement
2: Prepares food for special events and functions in accordance with menu plans and kitchen protocols.
Maintains a clean and organized workspace, adhering to health and safety standards.
Assists with meal preparation, plating, and presentation according to hotel standards.
Participates in inventory management and order procurement of ingredients and supplies.
Resolves any food quality or allergy issues that arise during service.
Manages cash handling and credit transactions accurately and efficiently.
Maintains accurate records of menu offerings, recipes, and allergen information.
Receives, stores, and distributes fresh produce and meat products according to schedule.
Participates in staff meetings to discuss food quality, inventory levels, and employee concerns.
Operates and maintains kitchen equipment, including ovens, stoves, and refrigerators.
Ensures all food is prepared, handled, and served safely according to local regulations.
Responsible for monitoring and controlling energy consumption within the kitchen area.
